concise_definition: v. 赚得, 获得, 值得

definitions.explanation_en: To receive money or other compensation as a result of work, effort, or service performed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因工作、努力或提供服务而获得金钱或其他形式的报酬。
definitions.example_en: She earned a substantial salary by working overtime every week.
definitions.example_cn: 她每周加班，赚取了可观的薪水。

definitions.explanation_en: To deserve or merit something, especially praise, respect, or a reward, through one's actions or qualities.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过自己的行为或品质而赢得某种应得的赞誉、尊重或奖励。
definitions.example_en: His honesty and integrity earned him the trust of the entire team.
definitions.example_cn: 他的诚实与正直赢得了整个团队的信任。

definitions.explanation_en: To acquire something through sustained effort or perseverance, often implying a sense of achievement or rightful claim.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过持续的努力或毅力获得某物，常暗示一种成就感或正当的拥有权。
definitions.example_en: After years of training, he earned his place on the national team.
definitions.example_cn: 经过多年的训练，他赢得了进入国家队的资格。

comparison.analysis: “Received” (收到) 是一个中性词，仅表示被动地接受某物，不涉及是否通过努力或值得而获得。例如收到礼物或信件。而 “earned” 强调通过个人努力、能力或贡献而获得，带有道德或价值上的正当性。
“Gained” (获得) 范围更广，可指任何方式的获取，包括偶然、被动或非努力的结果（如 gained weight, gained experience）。而 “earned” 特指通过付出努力、技能或牺牲而获得，隐含“应得”的含义，情感色彩更强烈。
“Deserved” (应得) 是一个形容词性动词，强调某人“配得上”某种结果，但不一定已经获得。例如：He deserved to win.（他本该赢）。而 “earned” 不仅表示应得，更强调已经通过行动实现了这一结果。两者常可互换，但 “earned” 更具行动导向。
